title: Boost Compatibility with Key Dependency Upgrades

topics.title: User Interface Improvements
topics.summary: Recent pull requests focus on enhancing the user interface of the npmx platform. Changes include fixing icon sizes, improving clickability of social cards, and refining chart designs. These updates aim to enhance user experience and accessibility across the platform.

topics.title: Performance Enhancements
topics.summary: Several pull requests have been merged to improve the performance of the npmx application. This includes server-side HTML entity decoding and optimizations in chart rendering, which aim to enhance loading times and overall responsiveness.

topics.title: Issue Resolutions
topics.summary: Multiple issues have been resolved, addressing user feedback and enhancing functionality. Notable resolutions include fixing the governance card's new tab icon and reducing the size of anchor icons in package headers.

topics.title: Community Engagement
topics.summary: The npmx community is actively engaging through platforms like Bluesky, with announcements about reopening chat channels and discussions about upcoming events. This fosters a sense of community and encourages user participation.

topics.title: Dependency Updates
topics.summary: The project has undergone several dependency updates, including the bumping of packages like vue-data-ui and focus-trap. These updates are crucial for maintaining compatibility and leveraging improvements from third-party libraries.

topics.title: Internationalization Efforts
topics.summary: Recent contributions have focused on updating translations for various languages, including Czech, Japanese, and German. These efforts aim to make the npmx platform more accessible to a diverse user base.
